tool_description: An API for trading on Kalshi, a CFTC regulated exchange.
name: Kalshi Trading API
title: Kalshi Trading API

api_list.name: GetExchangeStatus
api_list.description: Endpoint for getting the exchange status.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://kalshi-trading-api.p.rapidapi.com/exchange/status"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "kalshi-trading-api.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://kalshi-trading-api.p.rapidapi.com/exchange/status"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "kalshi-trading-api.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

exchange_active.description: False if the core Kalshi exchange is no longer taking any state changes at all. This includes but is not limited to trading, new users, and transfers. True unless we are under maintenance.

trading_active.description: True if we are currently permitting trading on the exchange. This is true during trading hours and false outside exchange hours. Kalshi reserves the right to pause at any time in case issues are detected.

api_list.name: GetMarket
api_list.description:
Endpoint for getting data about a specific market.

The value for the ticker path parameter should match the ticker of the target market.

required_parameters.name: ticker
required_parameters.description: Market ticker for the market being retrieved.

market.description:
Market
Contains information about a market. Note: for some fields, you should not assume a fixed structure.

can_close_early.description: If true then this market can close earlier then the time provided on close_time.

close_time.description: Date and time in the ISO 8601 spec. Example: 2022-11-30T15:00:00Z

custom_strike.description:
Expiration value for each target that leads to a YES settlement.

Filled only if "strike_type" is "custom".

expiration_time.description: Date and time in the ISO 8601 spec. Example: 2022-11-30T15:00:00Z

expiration_value.description: The value that was considered for the settlement.

last_price.description: Price for the last traded yes contract on this market.

liquidity.description: Value for current offers in this market in cents.

no_ask.description: Price for the lowest NO sell offer on this market.

no_bid.description: Price for the highest NO buy offer on this market.

open_interest.description: Number of contracts bought on this market disconsidering netting.

open_time.description: Date and time in the ISO 8601 spec. Example: 2022-11-30T15:00:00Z

previous_price.description: Price for the last traded yes contract on this market a day ago.

previous_yes_ask.description: Price for the lowest YES sell offer on this market a day ago.

previous_yes_bid.description: Price for the highest YES buy offer on this market a day ago.

risk_limit_cents.description: Risk limit for this market in cents.

status.description: Represents the current status of a market.

strike_type.description:
Strike type defines how the market strike (expiration value) is defined and evaluated.

greater: It will be a single number. For YES outcome the expiration value should be greater than "floor_strike".

greater_or_equal: It will be a single number. For YES outcome the expiration value should be greater OR EQUAL than "floor_strike".

less: It will be a single number. For YES outcome the expiration value should be less than "cap_strike".

less_or_equal: It will be a single number. For YES outcome the expiration value should be less OR EQUAL than "cap_strike".

between: It will be two numbers. For YES outcome the expiration value should be between inclusive "floor_strike" and "cap_strike", that means expiration value needs to be greater or equal "floor_strike" and less or equal "cap_strike".

custom: It will be one or more non-numerical values. For YES outcome the expiration values should be equal to the values in "custom_strike".

volume.description: Number of contracts bought on this market.

volume_24h.description: Number of contracts bought on this market in the past day.

yes_ask.description: Price for the lowest YES sell offer on this market.

yes_bid.description: Price for the highest YES buy offer on this market.

api_list.name: GetTrades
api_list.description: Endpoint for getting all trades for all markets.

optional_parameters.name: min_ts
optional_parameters.description: Restricts the response to trades after a timestamp.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Parameter to specify the number of results per page. Defaults to 100.

optional_parameters.name: ticker
optional_parameters.description: Parameter to specify a specific market to get trades from.

optional_parameters.name: cursor
optional_parameters.description:
The Cursor represents a pointer to the next page of records in the pagination.
So this optional parameter, when filled, should be filled with the cursor string returned in a previous request to this end-point.
Filling this would basically tell the api to get the next page containing the number of records passed on the limit parameter.
On the other side not filling it tells the api you want to get the first page for another query.
The cursor does not store any filters, so if any filter parameters like ticker, max_ts or min_ts were passed in the original query they must be passed again.

optional_parameters.name: max_ts
optional_parameters.description: Restricts the response to trades before a timestamp.

cursor.description:
The Cursor represents a pointer to the next page of records in the pagination.
Use the value returned here in the cursor query parameter for this end-point to get the next page containing limit records.
An empty value of this field indicates there is no next page.

items.description:
Represents a trade that can be displayed publicly. This does not include maker and taker information.

A trade is created whenever an order is fully or partially matched.
items.title: PublicTrade

count.description: Number of contracts to be bought or sold.

created_time.description: Date and time in the ISO 8601 spec. Example: 2022-11-30T15:00:00Z

no_price.description: No price for this trade in cents.

taker_side.description: Side for the taker of this trade.

yes_price.description: Yes price for this trade in cents.

api_list.name: GetEvents
api_list.description: Endpoint for getting data about all events.

optional_parameters.name: series_ticker
optional_parameters.description: Series ticker to retrieve contracts for.

optional_parameters.name: status
optional_parameters.description:
Restricts the events to those with certain statuses, as a comma separated list.
The following values are accepted: open, closed, settled.

optional_parameters.name: cursor
optional_parameters.description:
The Cursor represents a pointer to the next page of records in the pagination.
So this optional parameter, when filled, should be filled with the cursor string returned in a previous request to this end-point.
Filling this would basically tell the api to get the next page containing the number of records passed on the limit parameter.
On the other side not filling it tells the api you want to get the first page for another query.
The cursor does not store any filters, so if any filter parameters like series_ticker was passed in the original query they must be passed again.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Parameter to specify the number of results per page. Defaults to 100.

api_list.name: GetMarketOrderbook
api_list.description: Endpoint for getting the orderbook for a market.

optional_parameters.name: depth
optional_parameters.description: Depth specifies the maximum number of orderbook price levels on either side.

api_list.name: GetSeries
api_list.description: Endpoint for getting data about a series by its ticker.

required_parameters.name: series_ticker
required_parameters.description: Should be filled with the ticker of the series.

series.description:
Represents a group of events that have the same underlying source.

For example: Fed interest rate hikes is a series with multiple events, one for each FOMC meeting.
series.title: Series

frequency.description: Description of the frequency of the series. There is no fixed value set here, but will be something human-readable like: weekly, daily, one-off.

title.description: Title describing the series. For full context use you should use this field with the title field of the events belonging to this series.

api_list.name: GetMarkets
api_list.description: Endpoint for listing and discovering markets on Kalshi.

optional_parameters.name: cursor
optional_parameters.description:
The Cursor represents a pointer to the next page of records in the pagination.
So this optional parameter, when filled, should be filled with the cursor string returned in a previous request to this end-point.
Filling this would basically tell the api to get the next page containing the number of records passed on the limit parameter.
On the other side not filling it tells the api you want to get the first page for another query.
The cursor does not store any filters, so if any filter parameters like tickers, max_ts or min_ts were passed in the original query they must be passed again.

optional_parameters.name: event_ticker
optional_parameters.description: Event ticker to retrieve markets for.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Parameter to specify the number of results per page. Defaults to 100.

optional_parameters.name: status
optional_parameters.description:
Restricts the markets to those with certain statuses, as a comma separated list.
The following values are accepted: open, closed, settled.

optional_parameters.name: tickers
optional_parameters.description: Restricts the markets to those with certain tickers, as a comma separated list.

optional_parameters.name: min_close_ts
optional_parameters.description: Restricts the markets to those that are closing in or after this timestamp.

optional_parameters.name: series_ticker
optional_parameters.description: Series ticker to retrieve contracts for.

optional_parameters.name: max_close_ts
optional_parameters.description: Restricts the markets to those that are closing in or before this timestamp.

api_list.name: GetEvent
api_list.description: Endpoint for getting data about an event by its ticker.

required_parameters.name: event_ticker
required_parameters.description: Should be filled with the ticker of the event.

mutually_exclusive.description: If true then the event is mutually exclusive.

strike_date.description: Date and time in the ISO 8601 spec. Example: 2022-11-30T15:00:00Z

strike_period.description:
The strike period for this event. This will be filled when the event strike is not a date.
If it is a date then the 'strike_date' field should be filled instead.

markets.description: Data for the markets in this event.

items.description:
Market
Contains information about a market. Note: for some fields, you should not assume a fixed structure.

can_close_early.description: If true then this market can close earlier then the time provided on close_time.

close_time.description: Date and time in the ISO 8601 spec. Example: 2022-11-30T15:00:00Z

custom_strike.description:
Expiration value for each target that leads to a YES settlement.

Filled only if "strike_type" is "custom".

expiration_time.description: Date and time in the ISO 8601 spec. Example: 2022-11-30T15:00:00Z

expiration_value.description: The value that was considered for the settlement.

last_price.description: Price for the last traded yes contract on this market.

liquidity.description: Value for current offers in this market in cents.

no_ask.description: Price for the lowest NO sell offer on this market.

no_bid.description: Price for the highest NO buy offer on this market.

open_interest.description: Number of contracts bought on this market disconsidering netting.

open_time.description: Date and time in the ISO 8601 spec. Example: 2022-11-30T15:00:00Z

previous_price.description: Price for the last traded yes contract on this market a day ago.

previous_yes_ask.description: Price for the lowest YES sell offer on this market a day ago.

previous_yes_bid.description: Price for the highest YES buy offer on this market a day ago.

risk_limit_cents.description: Risk limit for this market in cents.

status.description: Represents the current status of a market.

strike_type.description:
Strike type defines how the market strike (expiration value) is defined and evaluated.

greater: It will be a single number. For YES outcome the expiration value should be greater than "floor_strike".

greater_or_equal: It will be a single number. For YES outcome the expiration value should be greater OR EQUAL than "floor_strike".

less: It will be a single number. For YES outcome the expiration value should be less than "cap_strike".

less_or_equal: It will be a single number. For YES outcome the expiration value should be less OR EQUAL than "cap_strike".

between: It will be two numbers. For YES outcome the expiration value should be between inclusive "floor_strike" and "cap_strike", that means expiration value needs to be greater or equal "floor_strike" and less or equal "cap_strike".

custom: It will be one or more non-numerical values. For YES outcome the expiration values should be equal to the values in "custom_strike".

volume.description: Number of contracts bought on this market.

volume_24h.description: Number of contracts bought on this market in the past day.

yes_ask.description: Price for the lowest YES sell offer on this market.

yes_bid.description: Price for the highest YES buy offer on this market.

api_list.name: GetMarketHistory
api_list.description:
Endpoint for getting the statistics history for a market.

The value for the ticker path parameter should match the ticker of the target market.
The min_ts parameter is optional, and will restrict statistics to those after provided timestamp.
The min_ts is inclusive, which means a market history point at min_ts will be returned.

optional_parameters.name: cursor
optional_parameters.description:
The Cursor represents a pointer to the next page of records in the pagination.
So this optional parameter, when filled, should be filled with the cursor string returned in a previous request to this end-point.
Filling this would basically tell the api to get the next page containing the number of records passed on the limit parameter.
On the other side not filling it tells the api you want to get the first page for another query.
The cursor does not store any filters, so if any filter parameters like max_ts or min_ts were passed in the original query they must be passed again.

optional_parameters.name: min_ts
optional_parameters.description: If provided, MinTs restricts history to trades starting from MinTs.  Default value: 1 hour ago.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Parameter to specify the number of results per page. Defaults to 100.

optional_parameters.name: max_ts
optional_parameters.description: If provided, MaxTs restricts history to trades up until MaxTs

cursor.description:
The Cursor represents a pointer to the next page of records in the pagination.
Use the value returned here in the cursor query parameter for this end-point to get the next page containing limit records.
An empty value of this field indicates there is no next page.

no_ask.description: Price for the lowest NO sell offer on the market by the timestamp in the request (ts).

no_bid.description: Price for the highest NO buy offer on the market by the timestamp in the request (ts).

open_interest.description: Number of contracts bought on the market by the timestamp in the request (ts) disconsidering netting.

ts.description: Unix timestamp for the current statistics entry.

volume.description: Number of contracts bought on the market by the timestamp in the request (ts).

yes_ask.description: Price for the lowest YES sell offer on the market by the timestamp in the request (ts).

yes_bid.description: Price for the highest YES buy offer on the market by the timestamp in the request (ts).

yes_price.description: Price for the last traded yes contract on the market by the timestamp in the request (ts).

api_list.name: GetPortfolioSettlements
api_list.description: Endpoint for getting the logged-in member's settlements historical track.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Parameter to specify the number of results per page. Defaults to 100.

optional_parameters.name: cursor
optional_parameters.description:
The Cursor represents a pointer to the next page of records in the pagination.
So this optional parameter, when filled, should be filled with the cursor string returned in a previous request to this end-point.
Filling this would basically tell the api to get the next page containing the number of records passed on the limit parameter.
On the other side not filling it tells the api you want to get the first page for another query.

api_list.name: GetOrders
api_list.description: Endpoint for getting all orders for the logged-in member.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Parameter to specify the number of results per page. Defaults to 100.

optional_parameters.name: max_ts
optional_parameters.description: Restricts the response to orders before a timestamp, formatted as a Unix Timestamp.

optional_parameters.name: ticker
optional_parameters.description: Restricts the response to orders in a single market.

optional_parameters.name: min_ts
optional_parameters.description: Restricts the response to orders after a timestamp, formatted as a Unix Timestamp.

optional_parameters.name: status
optional_parameters.description: Restricts the response to orders that have a certain status: resting, canceled, or executed.

optional_parameters.name: event_ticker
optional_parameters.description: Restricts the response to orders in a single event.

optional_parameters.name: cursor
optional_parameters.description:
The Cursor represents a pointer to the next page of records in the pagination.
So this optional parameter, when filled, should be filled with the cursor string returned in a previous request to this end-point.
Filling this would basically tell the api to get the next page containing the number of records passed on the limit parameter.
On the other side not filling it tells the api you want to get the first page for another query.
The cursor does not store any filters, so if any filter parameters like ticker, max_ts or min_ts were passed in the original query they must be passed again.

cursor.description:
The Cursor represents a pointer to the next page of records in the pagination.
Use the value returned here in the cursor query parameter for this end-point to get the next page containing limit records.
An empty value of this field indicates there is no next page.

items.description:
Represents member orders in the API.

When an order is matched multiple trades can be created this can be tracked by looking into the trade.orderId field.
items.title: Order

action.description: Representing trade action; currently supports buy and sell.

client_order_id.description: Optional unique identifier for order placement.

close_cancel_count.description: The size of resting orders canceled because of market close (contract units).

created_time.description: Date and time in the ISO 8601 spec. Example: 2022-11-30T15:00:00Z

decrease_count.description: The reduction in the size of resting for orders (contract units).

expiration_time.description: Date and time in the ISO 8601 spec. Example: 2022-11-30T15:00:00Z

fcc_cancel_count.description: The size of resting contracts canceled because of exchange operations (contract units).

last_update_time.description: Date and time in the ISO 8601 spec. Example: 2022-11-30T15:00:00Z

maker_fill_count.description: The size of filled maker orders (contract units).

no_price.description:
Submitting price of the No side of the trade, in cents.
Exactly one of yes_price and no_price must be passed. If both prices are passed, return 400.

place_count.description: the size of placed maker orders (contract units).

queue_position.description: Position in the priority queue at a given price level

remaining_count.description: The size of the remaining resting orders (contract units).

side.description: Representing direction of the order; currently supports yes and no.

status.description: The current status of this order.

taker_fees.description: Fees paid on filled orders, in cents.

taker_fill_cost.description: The cost of filled taker orders in cents.

taker_fill_count.description: The size of filled taker orders (contract units)

type.description: Representing order type; currently supports "market" and "limit".

yes_price.description: The yes price for this order in cents.

api_list.name: GetPositions
api_list.description: Endpoint for getting all market positions for the logged-in member.

optional_parameters.name: ticker
optional_parameters.description: Ticker of desired positions.

optional_parameters.name: event_ticker
optional_parameters.description: Event ticker of desired positions.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Parameter to specify the number of results per page. Defaults to 100.

optional_parameters.name: settlement_status
optional_parameters.description: Settlement status of the markets to return. Defaults to unsettled.

optional_parameters.name: cursor
optional_parameters.description:
The Cursor represents a pointer to the next page of records in the pagination.
So this optional parameter, when filled, should be filled with the cursor string returned in a previous request to this end-point.
Filling this would basically tell the api to get the next page containing the number of records passed on the limit parameter.
On the other side not filling it tells the api you want to get the first page for another query.
The cursor does not store any filters, so if any filter parameters like settlement_status, ticker, or event_ticker were passed in the original query they must be passed again.

api_list.name: GetBalance
api_list.description: Endpoint for getting the balance of the logged-in member.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://kalshi-trading-api.p.rapidapi.com/portfolio/balance"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "kalshi-trading-api.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://kalshi-trading-api.p.rapidapi.com/portfolio/balance"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "kalshi-trading-api.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: GetOrder
api_list.description: Endpoint for getting a single order.

required_parameters.name: order_id
required_parameters.description: Order_id input for the current order.

api_list.name: GetFills
api_list.description: Endpoint for getting all fills for the logged-in member.

optional_parameters.name: cursor
optional_parameters.description:
The Cursor represents a pointer to the next page of records in the pagination.
So this optional parameter, when filled, should be filled with the cursor string returned in a previous request to this end-point.
Filling this would basically tell the api to get the next page containing the number of records passed on the limit parameter.
On the other side not filling it tells the api you want to get the first page for another query.
The cursor does not store any filters, so if any filter parameters like ticker, max_ts or min_ts were passed in the original query they must be passed again.

optional_parameters.name: ticker
optional_parameters.description: Restricts the response to trades in a specific market.

optional_parameters.name: max_ts
optional_parameters.description: Restricts the response to trades before a timestamp.

optional_parameters.name: order_id
optional_parameters.description: Restricts the response to trades related to a specific order.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Parameter to specify the number of results per page. Defaults to 100.

optional_parameters.name: min_ts
optional_parameters.description: Restricts the response to trades after a timestamp.
